content.text: Comparison operators and logical operators are essential for making decisions in Python. They allow you to compare values, check conditions, and combine multiple evaluations within an if statement. With them, you can build more complete rules, such as checking whether an age is within a range, whether a password matches, or whether an action is valid only under certain conditions.
These operators return True or False, depending on the condition.
They allow you to combine conditions.
At least one condition must be true.
Inverts the logical value: If it was True it becomes False, and if it was False it becomes True.

content.text: In this unit, you learned how to compare values and combine conditions using comparison operators and logical operators. Now you can build more precise rules within your programs, evaluate ranges, check multiple situations at the same time, and control the flow of decisions more accurately. Mastering these operators will allow you to write smarter and more adaptable code.
